flavorText: "Let my lance sing with the voices of angels and the heathen cower before my shield, for I will teach this land the meaning of honor."

foreignData.flavorText: „Meine Lanze soll mit den Stimmen der Engel singen und mein Schild die Heiden in die Knie zwingen, denn ich werde diesem Land den Begriff der Ehre beibringen."

foreignData.flavorText: "Deja que mi lanza cante con las voces de los ángeles y los malvados teman mi escudo, porque enseñaré a esta tierra el significado del honor."

foreignData.flavorText: « Que ma lance chante avec la voix des anges et que les païens tremblent devant mon bouclier, car j'apprendrai à ce pays la signification de l'honneur. »

foreignData.flavorText: "Lasciate che la mia lancia accompagni le voci degli angeli e che i pagani si riparino dietro al mio scudo, perché sarò io ad insegnare a questa terra il significato della parola onore."

foreignData.flavorText: 「我が槍に天使の歌声を奏でさせ、我が盾の前に異教徒を挫けさしめよ。さればこの地に、名誉の何たるかを知らしめん。」

name: Paragon of the Amesha
originalText:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Paragon of the Amesha becomes an Angel, gets +3/+3, and gains flying and lifelink.

rulings.text: When Paragon of the Amesha’s activated ability resolves, Paragon of the Amesha will gain flying and lifelink in addition to its other abilities. However, becoming an Angel will make it lose all other creature types. It will no longer be a Human or a Knight.
If Paragon of the Amesha gains flying after blockers have been declared, it won’t cause those blocks to change.

You can activate Paragon of the Amesha’s ability more than once during a turn. The second time it resolves, it will get another +3/+3 and gain another instance of lifelink. However, multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant so you won’t gain extra life from the new one.

text:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Paragon of the Amesha becomes an Angel, gets +3/+3, and gains flying and lifelink.
